stateCompliance.headline: California Payday Loan Regulations Protecting Anaheim Residents
stateCompliance.content: Anaheim residents are protected by California's strict Deferred Deposit Transaction Law, regulated by the California Department of Financial Protection and Innovation (DFPI). California has implemented stronger borrower protections than most states, including loan amount limits, fee restrictions, and prohibitions on predatory lending practices.
keyPoints: Maximum loan amount: $300 including all fees (typical cash is $255 with $45 maximum fee)
Fee cap: 15% maximum fee on the check amount (approximately 460% APR for 14-day loans)
One active loan only: Can't take out a new loan while one is outstanding
No rollovers permitted: Lenders cannot refinance or roll over existing loans
No criminal threats: Lenders prohibited from threatening criminal prosecution
NSF fees limited: Only one $15 NSF fee per bounced check
Full disclosure required: All fees stated clearly in dollars and APR
License verification: All California payday lenders must be DFPI-licensed and verified
stateCompliance.regulatoryBody: California Department of Financial Protection and Innovation (DFPI)
stateCompliance.disclaimer: This information is for general educational purposes only and does not constitute legal advice. Payday loan laws may change. For current information, contact the DFPI at 1-866-275-2677 or visit dfpi.ca.gov. Consult a California attorney for specific legal questions. Individual lender terms vary within California law limits.

nearbyLocations.headline: Also Serving Nearby Orange County Cities
nearbyLocations.intro: Can't make it to Anaheim? We serve these neighboring Orange County communities:

faq.question: Where can I find your Anaheim cash advance location?
faq.answer: We're located at 1250 South Harbor Boulevard, Suite 110, right in the heart of Anaheim near Disneyland and the Convention Center. Take I-5 Exit 110A toward Harbor Boulevard for easy access. Plenty of parking available.

faq.question: What documents do I need in Anaheim?
faq.answer: Bring a valid government ID (driver's license, passport, or ID card), recent proof of income (pay stub or bank statements), and an active checking account. That's all you need for approval in most cases.

faq.question: How much can I borrow in Orange County?
faq.answer: California law limits loans to $300 maximum including fees. Typically, you'll receive $255 cash with a $45 fee under California's 15% fee cap. Your specific amount depends on your income and credit situation.

faq.question: Can I apply online for Anaheim?
faq.answer: Yes! You can apply online and then visit our Harbor Boulevard location to complete the verification and receive your cash. We also welcome walk-ins with no appointment necessary.

faq.question: What are your Anaheim location hours?
faq.answer: We're open Monday-Friday 9 AM to 6 PM, Saturday 10 AM to 4 PM, and closed Sundays. Visit during these times or apply online anytime for quick processing.
